result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel P. Reyes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two or if not perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
NO days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel P. Reyes

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:40 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Amended  Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
Parties may submit stipulation re: jail credit as needed. 
Adj: 10:47 am
